intro: Anisotoma, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with white to yellow petals and a central disc of florets. They are often found in grasslands and rocky habitats, and some species are cultivated for their ornamental value. Anisotoma species are also known for their ability to thrive in arid conditions.
